intro: Phyllarthron sahamalazensis, commonly known as the Saha Malazian fern, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Georgia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, intricate fronds that display a complex arrangement of pinnae and pinnules. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often growing on rock faces or in dense forest undergrowth. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the underside of its leaves, typical of many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Phyllarthron sahamalazensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
